# The University of Chicago

  &nbsp; 

[**PPHA 32736: Economics, Politics, and African Societies**](https://harris.uchicago.edu/academics/programs-degrees/courses/economics-politics-and-african-societies)

Inter-disciplinary course for all levels, but primarily aimed at PhD in social sciences interested in conducting research in Africa.

Taught by Professors [James A. Robinson](https://voices.uchicago.edu/jamesrobinson/) and [Raúl Sánchez de la Sierra](https://raulsanchezdelasierra.com).

  &nbsp;

[(Syllabus)](files/peassyll.pdf) [(Evaluations)](files/peaseval.pdf) [(Teaching Materials)](https://github.com/vincentanutama/african-development)

[**PPHA 44100: Advanced Microeconomics for Policy Analysis I**](https://harris.uchicago.edu/academics/programs-degrees/courses/advanced-microeconomics-policy-analysis-i-phd-level-fall-2022)

First-year PhD / MACRM Microeconomics sequence.

Taught by Professor [Francisco Espinosa](https://www.nber.org/people/francisco_espinosa?page=1&perPage=50).

  &nbsp; 
  
[**PBPL 20000: Economics for Public Policy**](http://collegecatalog.uchicago.edu/thecollege/publicpolicystudies/)

Introductory economics course for students in the College.

Taught by Professor [Ryan Kellogg](http://kelloggryan.com).
